questions.question: Why are you applying for an open-source project?
questions.label: Why are you applying for an open-source project?
questions.response: Open source projects are honestly the backbone behind the internet. There are so many projects out there that are either unfinished or terrible, and then users have to pay for them, and cant even edit it or attempt to make it better. Open source projects solve this by allowing users to modify the software and allow it to work in ways they personally want it to, also allowing them to improve upon it. I'm applying for an open source project because projects like PreMid really keep the internet a great place, and I always would like to give back. As well as that, I've been needing a new hobby lately, and this is something that I actually enjoy.

questions.question: Why are you applying for an open-source project?
questions.label: Why are you applying for an open-source project?
questions.response: I am applying for an open-source project because I believe that open-source projects should get a chance at everything. Open-source projects motivate people to do certain things, such as learning a new programming language. They can read over the code, and see if they can see what is happening in this script. I appreciate open-source projects as much as private projects, there isn't much of a difference. I have taken the opportunity to help moderate the PreMiD, instead of an alternative group because I believe that PreMiD acquires more ability and method than other groups. This project shows an exquisite opportunity to grow with it, and watch as it turns into a more flourishing and successful group as the days progress. I know that through effort and patience, this project will soon grow into an extremely inspirational and popular extension/application, that will allow people of all ages to enjoy the experience of using this extension/application.

questions.question: What qualities would you bring to the team?
questions.label: What qualities would you bring to the team?
questions.response: I bring high-qualities to the team to ensure customers get the best experience when requesting support. I believe all people should be treated equally, which is one quality, respect. I can give to you that others can not, is a heart. I not only set my limits high, but I also break those limits and exceed my expectations for the group and the staff. I help keep the staff healthy and happy. The group? Anyone can donate, anyone can work hard, anyone can serve people well. But characteristic traits of kindness and respect, are just from the heart. Not just anyone has that. I exceed my expectations mainly for the people of the group. Not for the group. Because without these people there would be no group. So I can't not pay them back. I'd like to thank those who make a group. Without these people, the word "group" would not have the correct meaning. I go far for these people. I save lives because time is short. Time is precious. These people sacrifice time for OUR group and harmony, together! So, thank you, all.

questions.question: Why should we choose you over other applicants?
questions.label: Why should we choose you over other applicants?
questions.response: You should hire me over others because I look past all of the whole big picture, and focus in on the little details. Sounds bad at first right? Wrong. You forgot, a camera has several points of view. I CAN look at the big picture, but dividing it and taking baby steps can be much better than rushing to do everything. This means, I focus on the Discord, the staff, the applications, the forms, the recruiting, rather than just running everything. I develop, and prepare. We want good, dedicated, workers. We want everything ready and prepared. I don't like to let things slide when they aren't fully corrected or done. It just isn't right. Patience is a very good thing to have, and It's honestly needed.
